entry.title: Godot C# setup procedure
entry.summary: In this short article, I will provide a setup guide for successfully running Godot with C#. Godot is a game engine that supports both 2D and 3D graphics, as well as multiple languages. While language support for C# is still in the works, it…
entry.content:
In this short article, I will provide a setup guide for successfully running Godot with C#. Godot is a game engine that supports both 2D and 3D graphics, as well as multiple languages. While language support for C# is still in the works, it may be useful for someone looking to transition from the Unity game engine to Godot.

Step 1:
As a first step, make sure to download the Godot mono version from the game engine's website or click the link below.

Godot Engine - Download | Windows


Step 2:

Download the visual studio build tools, which appear to be the only ones that work right now (or at a least the only one that I was able to get working)Step 3:

Step 3:

Run Godot and enjoy 

NOTE:

A recent issue that I encountered was that the build tools would not work. This was primarily due to a lack of properly installed Nougat.
